alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Montgomery (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 1:34PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Floyd and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 132 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated light rain due to showers across the advisory area. However, minor flooding is already occurring as runoff from heavy rain earlier today continues to collect in area creeks and rivers. Some low water crossings will be flooded and impassible through the afternoon. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Indian Creek, Dobbins Creek, Greasy Creek, East Prong Furnace Creek, Eckels Branch, Deepwater Creek, Dodd Creek, Beaver Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Brush Creek and Burks Fork. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Floyd... Willis... Indian Valley... Pilot... Alum Ridge... Rocky Knob Summit... Copper Valley... - For flooding safety information, please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
